Posts.Content: Oct 30, 2008 09:59AM carolt wrote: You are not a wimp, I just had my 2nd one a couple of weeks ago. It  hurt like crazy and it took over an hour and I ended up with a huge hematoma.  I told the surgeon I would never do that again, I'm going straight for surgery and he tried to be nice and say he had a difficult time with me because I have a lot of scar tissue.
Posts.Title: HELP NEEDED...Microcalcifications- biopsy coming up busymomof4 leaf

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 11:25AM carolt wrote: Hi All: I have to add my 2 cents, I think they are absolutely right, the longer the time in between is better, I have been thru calcifications twice now with the waiting period of 35-40 days each time and they were benign.  The waiting is the worst but you will get thru it.  My just ended on Tuersday. Carol

Posts.Content: Oct 31, 2008 06:35PM carolt wrote: Wow, that seems like a really long time,  I have only waited a few days for my other results, this past week I had to wait 6 days because the surgeon was misdialing and I could have jump out of my skin at any moment.  Thinking and planning for the worst which didn't come fortunately.  Waiting is the hardest, I know you can't relax but you have got to try.  Hang in there, I'll be thinking about you. Carol
